subject: Re: [junit] Classloader Cannot Find Resource
msgSnippet: Ugh.  Sorry everyone - it was a typo. *Hangs Head in Shame* --ee ... -- Preceda Design LLC www.precedadesign.com
messageBody:
Ugh. Sorry everyone - it was a typo.

*Hangs Head in Shame*

--ee

On Wed, 2003-09-24 at 21:44, Jason Rogers wrote:
> On 24 Sep 2003 19:00:13 -0500, "Eric Everman"
> <everman@...>
> said:
> > Hi- I'm using Junit (3.7?) with Eclipse.
> >
> > In my text case, I attempt to load an image as a resource. The
> thing
> > is, the class loader cannot find the resource. Here is the line,
> > resulting in url == null:
> >
> > URL url =
> >
> this.getClass().getResource("/com/preceda/webnews/test/world_map-906.png");
> >
> > This works fine in other code within the same project, but bombs
> inside
> > a test case. I know there is a special class loader used by JUnit
> to
> > allow tests to be rerun - is that class loader not able to load
> > resources?
>
> Correct me if I am wrong (and I am sure someone will :) but can't you
> use
> the System's classloader?
>
> --
> =jason
> [:question | ^One]
